segment.source: To use Advanced Group Policy Management (AGPM) to provide change control for a Group Policy object (GPO), you must first control the GPO with AGPM.
segment.target: To use Advanced Group Policy Management (AGPM) to provide change control for a Group Policy object (GPO), you must first control the GPO with AGPM.

segment.source: A user account with the Approver or AGPM Administrator (Full Control) role or necessary permissions in Advanced Group Policy Management is required to complete this procedure.
segment.target: A user account with the Approver or AGPM Administrator (Full Control) role or necessary permissions in Advanced Group Policy Management is required to complete this procedure.

segment.source: Review the details in "Additional considerations" in this topic.
segment.target: Review the details in "Additional considerations" in this topic.

segment.source: To control a previously uncontrolled GPO
segment.target: To control a previously uncontrolled GPO

segment.source: In the Group Policy Management Console tree, click Change Control in the forest and domain in which you want to manage GPOs.
segment.target: In the Group Policy Management Console tree, click Change Control in the forest and domain in which you want to manage GPOs.

segment.source: On the Contents tab in the details pane, click the Uncontrolled tab to display the uncontrolled GPOs.
segment.target: On the Contents tab in the details pane, click the Uncontrolled tab to display the uncontrolled GPOs.

segment.source: Right-click the GPO to be controlled with AGPM, and then click Control.
segment.target: Right-click the GPO to be controlled with AGPM, and then click Control.

segment.source: Type a comment to be displayed in the history of the GPO, and then click OK.
segment.target: Type a comment to be displayed in the history of the GPO, and then click OK.

segment.source: When the Progress window indicates that overall progress is complete, click Close.
segment.target: When the Progress window indicates that overall progress is complete, click Close.

segment.source: The GPO is removed from the list on the Uncontrolled tab and added to the Controlled tab.
segment.target: The GPO is removed from the list on the Uncontrolled tab and added to the Controlled tab.

segment.source: By default, you must be an Approver or an AGPM Administrator (Full Control) to perform this procedure.
segment.target: By default, you must be an Approver or an AGPM Administrator (Full Control) to perform this procedure.

segment.source: Specifically, you must have List Contents and Create GPO permissions for the domain.
segment.target: Specifically, you must have List Contents and Create GPO permissions for the domain.

segment.source: Creating, Controlling, or Importing a GPO
segment.target: Creating, Controlling, or Importing a GPO
